stories.title: Everything you ever wanted to know about UDP sockets but were afraid to ask

stories.text:
Now that the original ELIZA code is available (elizagen.org), we should figure out how to make it run. It's in MAD-SLIP. There's an Open Source MAD interpreter (due to ESR: http://www.catb.org/~esr/mad/) and JW published most of SLIP (with the notable exception of YMATCH and ASSMBL -- but these are well documented).

Oh...right, a question: Is there an open source challenges page where where folks could publish problems like this one?
stories.title: Make Mad Eliza Work

stories.text: Do you or your company use blockchain for anything which is not crypto trading or NFT? Have you run a trial? Have you ever contemplated using it for any use case?
